history.content: Probably best to ask HKN directly as noone has responded.

I can't give you concrete dates, but can give some ballpark answers. Generally the invitations will be sent around mid September (last year it was Sept. 16th), and the candidate meeting will be around the end of September. These exact dates will definitely be TBD.

As for requirements, the cutoff is not released to us, the College of Engineering handles most of the correspondence to to-be candidates. All we can say for sure is that invitations are extended to the top quarter of junior standing and top third of senior standing students.

I can't give you concrete dates, but can give some ballpark answers. Generally the invitations will be sent around mid September (last year it was Sept. 16th), and the candidate meeting will be around the end of September. These exact dates will definitely be TBD.

As for requirements, the cutoff is not released to us, the department handles most of the correspondence to to-be candidates. All we can say for sure is that invitations are extended to the top quarter of junior standing and top third of senior standing students.

I am a soon-to-be EECS sophomore. When will HKN invitations be released for next year's sophomores (accounting for both semesters of the last academic year)? What is the approximate GPA cutoff/range to qualify?

Thanks
history.subject: HKN Timeline and Qualifications
